column1: Madruga (Spanish pronunciation: [maˈðɾuɣa]) is a municipality and town in the Mayabeque Province of Cuba. It is located in the eastern part of the province
column2: between Matanzas and Güines. It was founded in 1803.
the municipality was divided into the barrios of Concordia and Cayajabos
column7: Sabana de Robles and San Blas.After 1973
column8: the municipality includes Madruga; Aguacate; Viviendas Campesinas; La Granja; Cayajabos Pipián and Flor de Itabo.

column2: the municipality of Madruga had a population of 30
column3: 640. With a total area of 464 km2 (179 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 66.0/km2 (171/sq mi).
